comment: 2 modules/wk (yea, fr) & each module has a full chapter of reading + reading primary sources + ab 30-60min in lectures, then a disc, then a practice quiz (no lockdown). you HAVE to do everything otherwise youll fail the tests. three tests, all lockdown 70-80 q's. it was alot of constant work, but i do feel like i learned the history really well tbh
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr.Lands is amazing! Her class is engaging and it is very easy to get an A as long as you put in the effort. Her readings are not that bad, and she will go over the reading guides the next day in class. Midterm and final are open note and super easy. Some group work in class, but it's nothing crazy. Cannot recommend her enough!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Respected

comment: Great lectures, just a lot of work and reading but is typical for a history class. Is efficient and emails back well. Her class is a lot with her summer class because each module is 3 days long, but not bad work and her lectures are very helpful. I would definitely make sure to read the textbook summaries before tests.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: This course was amazing and Professor Lands was very kind there were times when I messed up but a simple email fixed the issue.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--Online Savvy

comment: There is a lot of reading. Bulk of the grade came from 3 tests. Tests were not hard, just lengthy. I did the readings but otherwise never studied and did fine. Overall: well-structured class, but if you struggle with history, the tests could be a challenge, as the assignments don't provide much padding to cover for a bad grade on any of the exams.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Online Savvy

comment: Prof Lands cares about her students!! I had her for Historical Methods which is a very difficult class in my opinion. There is an essay due almost every week and if there is no essay due there is a lab that takes 3-4 hours to complete. However, if you get overwhelmed please email her and she will help you out and extend your deadline. Not an easy A
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: If you want to pass this class, dont take her. Please save your gpa. You have to read 5 chapters with 40 pages each and take a test. Lockdown browser. You have attendance buts your participation grade. It barely puts a dent in your grade. You have 3 tests if you fail the first one, drop the class
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Lands is pretty much how I would imagine the ideal professor to be- she gave us difficult, but easy-to-follow assignments, graded us fairly, and gave us good feedback. She's very accessible and has good online/tech-savvy experience. Her class was set up very effectively & taught me priceless info about historical writing. Worth taking!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Respected

comment: Dr. Lands was amazing for a low-stress online course. Weekly quiz/discussion post (participation grade) for the textbook chapter/primary sources, and you can take the quiz unlimited times. If you do the bare minimum amount of reading (key terms mainly), you can get high A's on the exams, which are really straight forward. Easy class and an easy A!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: This is my third time taking this professor and this class was the hardest of her classes but by far my favorite. This class is not content based but its goal is to teach you how to do research. There is a big project near the end (RP) that you have to get a 70 or higher on to pass the class. As long as you follow the directions you should be good.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class had 2 tests and many 2-3+ hour long projects. Professor is very clear on what she wants from you and can be super picky when grading. My complaint is that most of her lectures and examples to me are very politically driven and it can  be annoying.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: This class is about researching and how you write papers for history. If you are not good at writing papers you definitely need to read the writing aid book so that you can structure your paper well. The projects can take a lot of time and is where the grades mainly come from. The tests matter way less and are easy. Weekly participation posts
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: One of the best professors Ive ever had. Really cares about each individual student and will always give feedback on grades if asked. Easy to work with, and makes sure to check in if you get a bad grade or miss any assignments. Would definitely take her again and again!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Caring

comment: literally my favorite professor ever. she makes everything straightforward and gives awesome feedback so that you're actually learning. if i could take another one of her classes i absolutely would.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: As long as you read the required chapters and participate in the discussion posts you will pass this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: I would enjoy a lecture occasionally. Her' historical insight is the reason I took the course from her. I would like some feedback on my writing performance as well. Am I getting it? Who knows; you get points if you write and none if you don't. No makeup exams. Online "handouts" are obviously from previous courses that don't apply. Lazy teaching.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Professor Land's class is super straightforward. BUY THE TEXTBOOKS! It is necessary to pass as her tests expect you to reference primary sources. Every week there is readings from the textbook and other things for you to read. Following the reading, is an assignment and practice quiz. Other than that, the grades are just the tests. Would take again
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: This class is extremely textbook geared. Reading is the main way we learned anything in this class. Each week you have a designated reading and a discussion post and quiz over the reading. You can take the quizzes as many times as you want. Every 4 modules we had a test. If reading isn't your strong suit, I wouldn't take this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Lands made this class as clear-cut as possible. Lots of readings, 3 labs based on concepts learned in class, but they take 3 hours. Participation grade for module completion. Midterm and Final are the only tests, and both are cumulative, but there are other major assignments. If you put in the effort, it shouldn't be difficult to get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: Many of the people who have rated likely didnt take the course seriously and didnt study at all. I did the weekly readings, took notes, made flash cards, and studied hard for this course. History is reading intensive! You have to be prepared for that. I felt we we were given all our resources and provided exactly what info will be on the exams.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: HARDEST FREAKIN CLASS IVE EVER TAKEN!!!! The final is worth 50% of your grade and over 200 questions long. She expects you to quote primary sources in a closed note exam, when you've read like 50 sources throughout the semester. Literally impossible. No notes. Only textbook reading. NEVER TAKE THIS CLASS!!!
rating_tags: Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Lands was not the best professor. Her tests were extremely hard and you have to do a lot of reading. Her tests also used webcam which was annoying. She also never responds to emails. I definitely wouldn't take her if history is a subject you struggle with.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: discussion, quiz and reply every week. Also have to read a chapter a week which is like 20 or so pages. Tests are lockdown browser and very difficult. I dont know why she makes them so difficult. No study guides, no powerpoints. Just practice quizzes (which dont help enough to get an A or even a B) reading chapters. I would not recommen this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: This class was amazing. As long as you do the work, it is super easy to get an A. You definately have to put forward the time and effort, but it is really easy. Everything is due at 8AM on mondays, so that kind of sucked, but it was alright. I would get home from work on Sundays at 1am and still turn in my homework on time. Got A's on both tests.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: I was afraid of historical methods because I could not find anything definitive about the course. The class starts out with reading and finishes with a research plan based on the concepts learned throughout the semester. 3 labs that teach how to use archives, citations and databases 1 Archival visit and an analytical essay.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: The worst professor I have ever had. I won't take her even if she is the last professor alive - Due dates are on Mondays at 8.00am - Miss a quiz because of that thinking its at 11.59pm - Wont allow you to retake the quiz
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: You have to be a tough cookie to pass her class with anything better that a C. She even said it herself that no one has ever gotten an A on her exams. She's very much aware that her style of teaching isn't the best. RUN!
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY

comment: Very surprised this professor has a 4.0 rating. Basically your entire grade is based on two exams. There are no power points so everything you learn in this class is self taught. With that said, there is more reading for this class than I have ever had in any other class. I have a 3.8 gpa and I might fail this class. Seriously do not take her class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: She is very test heavy. Final grade rests on participation and 3 tests (all cumulative). She uses lockdown browser and webcam for all tests. Participation is an easy 100, but the tests are impossible. She also requires a TON of reading from 2 textbooks.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor was committed to learning thru participation in class group exercises as way to intrepret readings. Individual evaluation thru big individual project, short paper, group project, many quizzes. Exercises and quizzes were well constructed; professor clearly expert in subject but chose to let us work things out rather than impose answers.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Lands is a brilliant professor who in turn expects a lot from her students. She's no-nonsense. STUDY for her tests and take the practice quizzes multiple times before taking the tests (this will help you a lot, trust me, especially for the final). Make flash cards for key terms and add info from the practice quizzes to them to help you study.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: She expects you to know a LOT. Be ready to read and take really good notes every week, do two discussion posts, and take two long exams and an even longer final on a lock down browser with a webcam. You definitely do not get the easier end of the deal by taking this online as opposed to in person.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: If you are used to taking easy A online courses, this is not for you. There is a TON of readings, and your grade rests on two tests and a final, which are all cumulative. It is the hardest history course I have ever taken.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Good course to take online
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: As a 3.8 student... I was pretty excited to pass this course with a 76%. She requires a TON of reading out of two separate books and though she gives practice quizzes throughout the course, the entire grade comes down to 3 major tests, all cumulative.  Questions on the tests typically include questions like "Who would have said this?"
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: amazing women. very smart. class is tough, but if you work hard you will be fine. very approachable and easygoing.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: A great professor, just a whole lot of work load for the summer. For SURE would not recommend taking over a two-month span. Two modules, four responses, two discussion posts, 2 quizzes a week. A test every other week and the only grades are two tests and a final. Seems like an awesome professor, just way way way too much over the summertime.
Her tests are very challenging and all cumulative. She is a very nice professor with clear expectations. Weekly discussions that count toward your grade, two tests, and a final.

Took online, requires a lot of reading. She requires you to do at lease one post a week sometimes two, which aren't too bad and you have to participate in practice quizzes. The only hard part with this class is that your reading an entire chapter from two different books (2 chapters) a weeks and must read to pass tests.

She was so awesome. Took this online and it was so easy to know what she wanted. This was the type of stuff I needed to learn and she was more than willing to help. I messed up an assignment but she saw that it was the same mistake and didnt take off for every mistake. Give yourself time to do the labs and papers, they arent something you can rush

Professor Lands is a wonderful and knowledgeable instructor, however this class is very challenging. The tests were really hard, and its a lot of material for this class.  This class is very stressful as well. I would not recommend this class to anyone if youre not a great writer or editor. Other than that I would think twice about taking her.

She is a cool professor. You have multiple projects throughout the semester, no tests and an online quiz every week (which I thought were super hard). The quizzes dropped my grade so much and were the reason I got a B in the class instead of an A. It wasn't interesting to me at all, I wouldn't take it unless you love to read.
Not a bad class.

Brilliant professor. Lots of thought-provoking, relevant, and useful information presented. A class that encourages you to think about the interwoven causes of events rather than pushing you to regurgitate empty info like dates.
Really nice lady but super hard. We had to remember things down to certain telephone calls and arrests. Doesn't even go in chronological order. Nice but hard.

Nice lady. Very cool, just too smart to realize that the material she expects the class to know for the 3 exams that make up 100% of our grade was too much and detailed to remember unless you are a complete history buff.Very nice lady but not someone I would recommend unless you feel that a "B' or "C" is an okay grade for you.

I found this class both difficult and easy.  The prof doesn't teach in chronological order but you must know the order of events for the three cumulative multiple choice exams.  But if you attend or watch every lecture and write out a timeline for yourself, it'd be fairly easy. Prof makes history interesting and relevant; excellent class.
Dr. Lands is the bomb!

Dr. LeeAnn Lands is an excellent professor. She knows her field. This class had a ton of reading, weekly quizzes, and a light paper of five pages. You also had to peer review other student's papers (x2). Overall I would take any class she taught if I could.

Dr. Lands is amazing. She teaches a critical perspective and challenges every person differently. Class is very interactive - group work, spontaneous writing, every class is a surprise. A great methods teacher and a community involvement advocate. Do the reading - it's always good.
Prof Lands is awesome. Her lectures are very interesting and she finds ways to keep the class moving along. Don't take anyone else for this class!

Wonderful teacher! ususally, if a teacher doesn't use an outline on powerpoint, i get sort of lost, but she was great. she doesn't use powerpoint, but she's so thorough that you'll know exactly what to put down on your notes.

Dr.Lands is absolutely wonderful. Her lectures are interesting and she tries to use a variety of methods to keep your attention. Practice tests are given and the actual tests are no problem if you study.  Bonus questions are given to help you out even more. Take Dr.Lands if you can- I would take her again and again if I could.  WONDERFUL.

I have had Dr. Lands 3 times and every class I have learned so much and enjoy her lecture method. Be prepared to write and quizzes. She if a fair grader. If you don't like to be involved in discussion don't take her class.
great teacher
Excellent Lecturer
